page.title: 08Mayfield's Population.
page.content: The population of Mayfield in 1985 is 3,500.There are many elderly people most of whom have come to the village on retirement.Naturally there are also a number who have lived here all their lives.Another major group in Mayfield is the farming community but the commuters form the most important group.Many families have come to Mayfield because it is conveniently placed for the man of the house to travel to London,Eastbourne or Tunbridge Wells to work.This means that there are a lot of children in Mayfield.There are not very many employment opportunities in Mayfield and public transport is poor and housing expensive.All these factors mean that young people are forced to leave the village when they start working.This in turn means that the population is always changing.
